books.title: Test-Driven Development: By Example
books.author: Kent Beck
books.description: By the TDD creator, explains all steps he follows to problem-solving, including patterns.

books.title: Growing Object-Oriented Software, Guided by Tests
books.author: Steve Freeman, Nat Pryce
books.description: Combining examples with theory, a good book to learn TDD from London School perspective. It also combines TDDD with Object Oriented perspective from Rebbeca Wirsf-Brock.

books.title: Refactoring: Improving the Design of Existing Code 1st edition
books.author: Martin Fowler,

books.title: Refactoring: Improving the Design of Existing Code 2nd edition
books.author: Martin Fowler,
books.description: Improved refactoring concept explanations and workflows, in Javascript. It talks about Code Smells.

books.title: Implementation Patterns
books.author: Kent Beck
books.description: Similar to Clean code, in Java, including patterns and principles very useful.

books.title: Agile Principles, Patterns, and Practices in C#
books.author: Robert C. Martin, Micah Martin
books.description: Best explanation of SOLID principles and dependency design in C#.

books.title: Principles of Package Design
books.author: Matthias Noback
books.description: It gives a lot of PHP examples to dig into SOLID principles and how to manage dependency between packages.

books.title: Practical Object-Oriented Design: An Agile Primer Using Ruby, 2nd Edition
books.author: Sandi Metz
books.description: Genious exposition about modeling Object-Oriented behaviour and responsibilities.

books.title: Head First Design Patterns
books.author: Head First Series
books.description: Get to deep learn most used design patterns in a fun way!

books.title: The Pragmatic Programmer: From Journeyman to Master
books.author: Andrew Hunt and David Thomas
books.description: The book is focused on the principles and practices of software development, and it offers practical advice and tips to become a better programmer. Overall, the main lesson of the book is to be a pragmatic programmer who continuously improves their skills, uses a variety of tools and technologies, practices good coding habits, communicates effectively, and focuses on the big picture.

books.title: Working Effectively with Legacy Code
books.author: Michael Feathers
books.description: The book is aimed at software developers who work with legacy code and want to improve the quality, maintainability, and reliability of the code. It offers a range of techniques and tools that can be used to work with legacy code, including dependency breaking, characterization testing, and seam identification.

follows.name: Step4ward
follows.description: Inspiring and mentoring women in tech

follows.name: No me da la vida
follows.description: By Alba Silvente (@dawntraoz) and Miriam Gonz√°lez (@miriamgonp)

follows.name: Women Who Code
follows.description: International inclusive community producing trainings, conferences, hackatons...
